title: Electrochemical-catalytic NH3 synthesis from H2O and N2 using an electrochemical cell with a Ru catalyst, Pd–Ag membrane cathode, and NaOH–KOH molten salt electrolyte at 250 °C
content:
Energy Adv., 2024, 3,1265-1270
DOI: 10.1039/D4YA00218K, Communication
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Raisei Sagara, Rika Hayashi, Aika Hirata, Shintaroh Nagaishi, Jun Kubota
At 250 °C, using an electrochemical setup with a Ru catalyst, Pd alloy H2-permeable membrane cathode, NaOH–KOH molten salt electrolyte, and Ni anode, NH3 was synthesized from H2O and N2 with 30 mA cm−2 current density of and 25% current efficiency.
